page.title: 08Social Concerns
page.content:
Speed restrictions have recently been imposed on certain roads in and around the village after consistent pressure from local people concerned at the volume of heavy traffic passing through on a regular basis. Milk tankers, and lorries belonging to a nearby engineering works, are felt by many to be a constant potential hazard. The routes they take have been altered and their speed restricted to a certain degree.
New housing is another matter of local concern. Opinions are varied but there is a strong feeling that the character of the village must be retained and the older buildings safeguarded.
